sentence.Network_en: She had written him a note a couple of weeks earlier.
sentence.Network_cn: 她几周前给他写过一个便条。

sentence.Network_cn: 他的发言稿写得非常精彩，但他的演讲风格真是无可救药。

sentence.Network_en: He crossed out "Screenplay" and put "Written by" instead.
sentence.Network_cn: 他划掉了“编剧”二字，改为“作者”。

entry.def: Written is the past participle of write .
A written test or piece of work is one which involves writing rather than doing something practical or giving spoken answers.

example.ex: Learners may have to take a written exam before they pass their driving test...
example.tran: 学员在通过驾照考试前可能得参加笔试。

example.ex: Amy discovered that the theoretical and written work came easily to her.
example.tran: 埃米发现理论和笔头作业对她来说十分容易。

entry.tran: (协议、规定、法律等)成文的，书面的
entry.def: A written agreement, rule, or law has been officially written down.

example.ex: The newspaper broke a written agreement not to sell certain photographs...
example.tran: 这家报纸违反了不出售某些摄影作品的书面协议。

example.ex: We're waiting for written confirmation from the Americans.
example.tran: 我们在等美国人的书面确认。

Sentence.sentence: But while printing quickly caused the hand written book to die out, handwriting lingered on (继续存在) well into the 16th century.
When the essayists were later praised for their sympathy, they felt even worse about what they had written.
Send in a written application as soon as possible.
Texting has long been bemoaned (哀叹)as the downfall of the written word,""penmanship for illiterates,"as one critic called it.
It will ruin the written language
It has tens the decline of the written word.

sentences.en: Admission is obtained by written application.
sentences.cn: 要求录取须书面提出申请。

means.word_mean: (感情)全挂在脸上； 形之于色

sentences.en: You could see he was guilty; it was written all over his face.
sentences.cn: 你能看出他内心有愧，他脸上明明白白地写着呢。

means.word_mean: 明显受到…影响；显然有(某特点)

sentences.en: It’s been badly organized, as usual—it’s got the council written all over it.
sentences.cn: 像往常一样，这个活动组织混乱；你从各个方面都能看出理事会的拙劣之处。
